Message.Msg: LMRT

Topic.Title: If things are so bad then why didn't they preannounce.

Message.Msg: look, ibm has been buying back shares & cutting costs ahead of the quarter for decades to prop up earnings .....it isn't a temporary operational practice. it's just as permanent as the one-time......*every time* expense write offs that hpq takes every quarter.......these practices enable them to manage the balance sheet so they can *manage* to satisfy wall street expectations every quarter.....these are practices that are permanent and in no way should represent a healthy and principled financial state.....

Message.Title: UBS on IBM today
Message.Msg: IBM's quarter and guidance at UBS UBS believes IBM consensus quarterly revenue estimate of $25.36 is at risk due to the weak macro environment and soft emerging market demand, currently impact, and checks that indicate some hardware weakness. Despite the near-term risk, the analyst views IBM as a winner in big data and cloud and maintains its Buy rating and $235 price target.

Message.Title: new fed assurances float all boats.....
Message.Msg: until each announces earnings.......then we'll see. but what each company can't hide entirely, wall street analysts will apply maximum spin cover.......lol

Topic.Title: If things are so bad then why didn't they preannounce.

Message.Msg: btw, companies don't preannounce until and unless they know they are going to miss earnings......that they don't preannounce doesn't mean everything is just peachy.....
that conflicts directly with Goldman Sucks' outlook doesn't it. These analysts are such a sad bunch. They guess along with the rest of us. Meanwhile they can sink a ship at will.

Message.Title: The Tape Doesn't Lie
Message.Msg: Even before the Goldman downgrade, the tape action on IBM was terrible indicating a problem. Bew prepared for a much worse earnings and revenue report next week. Stock should be sold in trading accounts.
Maybe not, but you do.

I never in my life acknowledged that an analyst would at all help me. They work with the same data available to everyone. Why would you need to put any credence into what they say. I don't need an incompetent analysts to "advise me". I can make my own mistakes.

Certain "friendly" analysts may be being wined and dined by Corp. Communication at IBM to get the company's wanted message out; this particilar rosy outlook could be a planned counter to the Goldman Sachs"k pessimistic analysis as a means of damage control. That's what Corporate Communications' department staff is paid to do, isnt it?
